Description: Fragment from hat (?) with ear flaps; Constructed from patches of plain weave, wool cloth (green, red, blue and yellow) and bound and divided by strips of undyed, plain weave linen, includes appliqué; Decorated with dots of yellow (three) and pink (one) and backed with linen; Constructed as two separate panels, one a long strip with rounded end and the other an elongated semi-circle; Warp: wool, S spun, green c.10 tpc, red c.13 tpc, blue c.11 tpc, lemon yellow c.13 tpc, dark yellow c.10tpc; Weft: wool S spun, green c.22 tpc, red c.23 tpc, blue c.20 tpc, lemon yellow c.21 tpc, dark yellow c.30 tpc; Edges: hidden or ragged; Sewing: seaming and overcasting over folded-under edges in S spun, Z ply linen thread. Backing and binding is in plain weave, undyed linen of various quality, (h) backs longer panel, (i) backs subsidiary panel and (j & k) are binding strips; Warp: S spun, (h) c.6 tpc, (i) c.15 tpc, (j) c.11 tpc, (k) c.19 tpc; Weft: S spun (h) c.6 tpc, (i) c.14 tpc with self-strips, (j) c.11 tpc, (k) c.19 tpc; Edges: hidden or ragged.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupbaord 64, red box. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (23.5.1990)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
